teaser: American investors are pouring money into European stocks as the Euro crisis seems to be subsiding. And now vital signs in China, like retail sales and factory output, are improving. And a look into how taxes play into Microsoft's purchase of Nokia.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, September 10, 2013
byline: Jeff Tyler, Jim Burress, Rowan Moore Gerety, David Brancaccio, Allan Sloan, Molly Wood, Bruce Johnson, Mark Garrison and Johnny Niemann
description: American investors are pouring money into European stocks as the Euro crisis seems to be subsiding. And now vital signs in China, like retail sales and factory output, are improving. And a look into how taxes play into Microsoft's purchase of Nokia.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, September 10, 2013
